intro: Hexaglottis brevituba, commonly known as the narrow-tubed hexaglottis, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite and ovate in shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
